Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of road signs installed by the Swedish government to warn drivers about distracted walkers. The signs were actually an art installation created by two artists.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Sweden has installed road signs to warn drivers about distracted walkers. The signs mentioned were not official road signs and will soon be taken down.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the signs mentioned in the expert's verdict are official government-installed road signs when they were actually art installations.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists for the signs mentioned in the claim. They were created by artists to encourage people to pay attention to their surroundings rather than being official road signs.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the signs were not installed by the Swedish government but were instead part of an art installation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
